intro: Mecardonia exilis, commonly known as the slender mecardonia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its foliage is narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture. Mecardonia exilis is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
